subject: Economics
title: The Geography Hypothesis: Does Climate Determine Wealth?
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Geography Hypothesis: Does Climate Determine Wealth? usable.

hook.text: Almost every rich country is in a temperate zone. Almost every poor country is in the tropics.

buildup.text: Jared Diamond argued geography shaped development.

discovery.text: Tropical diseases (malaria kills 600,000/year), poor soils, and extreme weather create genuine economic headwinds.

twist.text: But Singapore is tropical with $65,000 GDP per capita. Botswana escaped poverty despite being landlocked in Africa.

climax.text: Geography matters â€” but institutions, policy, and history matter more.

punchline.text: Geography deals the cards. Institutions decide how you play them.

quiz.question: Why does the geography hypothesis fail to fully explain global inequality?
options: No poor countries are in the tropics
Tropical countries like Singapore have achieved high income, showing institutions and policy can overcome geographic constraints
Geography has zero effect on development
